wines.name: LeDomaine Blanco de Guarda 2024
wines.description:
Clean, brilliant, yellow, almost waxy in the glass. On the nose, an intense bouquet of
honey, peaches in syrup, ginger, white flowers and mint fused together with notes of
smoke. Smooth in the mouth, opening up with exotic citrus and white fruit (grapefruit
and apple), merged with a hint of freshly cut hay and aniseed, all blending well with the
wood. Perfectly balanced acidity that brings freshness and a lasting finish without
stepping on its rounded oiliness. A wine for laying down, a wine full of surprises.

wines.name: Tre Autoctoni N.V.

wines.name: Mocenni Particella 91 2020
wines.description:
Covering 1,000 hectares within the enchanting province of Siena, nestled in the historic and captivating city of Tuscany, Bindi Sergardi's vineyards have been crafting exceptional wines for centuries. With a legacy dating back to 1349 and spanning 23 generations, this family-operated winery is dedicated to encapsulating its rich heritage in each and every sip of its wines.

Celebrated as ‘a great super Tuscan’, Bindi Sergardi’s Mocenni Particella 91 is a hugely popular red wine among the Vivino community. One member comments, “I had doubts if the high Vivino rating can be justified. Certainly, it can.” Join hundreds of Vivino customers and try Bindi Sergardi Mocenni Particella 91 today.

With a taste as unique as its hue, this brick red sauvignon boasts a bouquet of black currant, blackberry, blueberries, oak, tobacco and chocolate. Full bodied, with medium maturing tannins and balanced acidity, you’ll find the Bindi Sergardi Mocenni Particella 91 has a long, pleasant aftertaste.

Perfectly pairs with beef, lamb, veal, poultry and cured meats, making it essential to have waiting in the wings for any dinner party. Bindi Sergardi Mocenni Particella 91 2016 vintage rates better than any other year for this wine, so it's a great starting point to sample this variety.

wines.name: Terrasse à l'Ombre Côtes du Rhône 2023
wines.region: France / Vallée du Rhône / Sud de la vallée du Rhône / Côtes-du-Rhône
wines.description:
Celebrated by Vivino users as ‘very complex’ and ‘punching way beyond its price point’, this bold and dry red wine is one of our most highly regarded wines. Maintaining its popularity with the Vivino community season after season, the Château de Gourdon Terrasse à l'Ombre Côtes du Rhône boasts notes of oak, vanilla and chocolate, as well as black fruits and spicy notes such as pepper and licorice. 

Renowned for their exquisite wine producing, the first vines at Château de Gourdon date back to 1870. Today, Château de Gourdon builds on this grand legacy and produces some of the very best French wines on offer, with a hint of this rich heritage in every sip.

The Château de Gourdon Terrasse à l'Ombre Côtes du Rhône 2019 vintage ranks #1 in the top 25 Southern Rhône Red wines in California right now, and with the distinctive flavor profile and ease of drinking, it’s easy to see why. Whereas, the 2018 vintage rates better than any other year for this wine.

Ideal for hosting, this Southern Rhône Red wine would be a match made in heaven with hearty beef, lamb and game dishes, as the flavor will intensify due to the way it interacts with the rich and savory characteristics of these meats.

wines.name: Mucho Más Tinto N.V.
wines.description:
One of the world's most renowned Spanish wines, N.V. Félix Solís Mucho Más Tinto is a fruity, yet deep full bodied red from Félix Solís, a family-run company that has its roots in heritage and history, while still managing to maintain its reputation of excellence. 

Sitting somewhere between dry and sweet, you can expect deep flavors of vanilla, oak and tobacco, enriched with sweet notes of red cherry and plum. Because of its slightly lighter flavor profile, this wine is perfect to be enjoyed at lunch or dinner, though our wine experts believe its best paired with beef, pasta, veal and poultry. It’s the perfect bottle to pick up and enjoy over lunch with friends, dinner with a loved one, or sipped together on the sofa on your next romantic date night. 

If you want to join the thousands of other Vivino users who have rated N.V. Félix Solís Mucho Más Tinto, pick up a bottle today, or lose yourself in our reviews, flavor profiles and winery profile before you decide to take the plunge.

wines.description: It has deep purple. The nose evokes notes of rose and liquorice. Aromas when young include cherry, strawberry and blackcurrant. Aromas when mature include leather, truffle, fur and game. The palate is vigorous and full-bodied. It is a wine that has a lot of body and consistency, with a balanced and solid structure. With a long finish, it is best appreciated if you keep it for a few years, with maturity softening it in a sensual and elegant way.

wines.description:
* A partir du millésime 2019, Goulée by Cos d’Estournel est renommé G d’Estournel.
* From the 2019 vintage, Goulée by Cos d’Estournel is renamed G d’Estournel.

The bounty and grace of nature. Goulée by Cos d’Estournel brings to mind a light sea breeze, refreshing eucalyptus and the tantalizing scents of juicy, ripe berries and rich cacao beans… Evoking an invigorating afternoon spent on the water with friends or a delicious meal in an oceanfront bistro softly lit by the glowing rays of the sun, Goulée by Cos d’Estournel is decidedly untamed, a bold and expressive wine.

wines.description: The joy and spontaneity of moments shared with loved ones. An impromptu lunch with friends is the perfect occasion to open a bottle of Pagodes de Cos. It is reminiscent of the simple pleasures of life, like homemade blackcurrant syrup, a bowl of just-picked red cherries or a freshly opened jar of citrus jam. Pagodes de Cos is at once indulgent, comforting and vivacious, like a carefree conversation with family or friends in a familiar place.

* A partir du millésime 2019, Goulée by Cos d’Estournel est renommé G d’Estournel.
* From the 2019 vintage, Goulée by Cos d’Estournel is renamed G d’Estournel.

The bounty and grace of nature. Goulée by Cos d’Estournel brings to mind a light sea breeze, refreshing eucalyptus and the tantalizing scents of juicy, ripe berries and rich cacao beans… Evoking an invigorating afternoon spent on the water with friends or a delicious meal in an oceanfront bistro softly lit by the glowing rays of the sun, Goulée by Cos d’Estournel is decidedly untamed, a bold and expressive wine.

wines.name: Tinto 2020
wines.description:
Smooth and deep ruby in color, Pago de Carraovejas Tinto is a robust red wine from the wine region of Ribera del Duero, Spain, which is located at the southern tip of the province of Burgos. It’s renowned for its cherry, blackberry and vanilla notes, alongside low acidity and low tannins. Perfect for wine connoisseurs and novices alike, it’s the perfect bottle to share alongside friends over a delicious dinner. 

As for pairings, this wine is an excellent choice to enjoy alongside meaty dishes that involve beef, lamb and game, so it’s perfect for sipping alongside a succulent steak dinner on date night. Made from the Tempranillo grape, this wine is rated highly across all of its vintages, however its 2018 vintage featured in the Top 25 Spanish Ribera del Duero red wines in the United States right now, so that might be a bottle you want to get your hands on. Additionally, its 2016 vintage rates better than any other year, so it’s fair to say this wine is an all round good choice, regardless of the vintage you choose. 

Read on for more reviews and pricing on Pago de Carraovejas Tinto at Vivino.

wines.name: Campo Masua Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2019
wines.region: Italie / Northern Italy / Vénétie / Valpolicella / Amarone della Valpolicella / Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
wines.description:
Campo Masua Amarone is the result of a selection process from a particularly suitable vineyard with ideal exposure and positioning, which make it one of the most interesting wines in our range. It is only produced in exceptional vintages; obtained from an accurate scrupulous selection of grapes from the vineyards, a 5 month raising process and ageing for 2 years in barrels and another year in the bottle. It is the synthesis of style and creativity while respecting traditions at the same time. A wine with an intriguing color, the nose expresses an intense, ethereal bouquet. The avour has charismatic personality with velvety tannins and a long echo of enveloping softness. Recommended with game, grilled meat, braised meat and mature cheeses.
Also enjoyable outside mealtimes in moments of meditation. Serve at 18°C, in wide-rimmed glasses, to enjoy its melodious nature.

wines.name: Castello della Sala Pinot Nero 2022
wines.description: Marchesi Antinori’s passion for viticulture is expressed through perseverance: their continuous pursuit for quality improvement, even in the smallest details. Research and development is an ongoing process both in the vineyards and in the cellars: selecting new clones of local and international varieties: experimenting with new techniques in the vineyards and vineyard altitudes, new approaches to fermentation and temperature control, experimenting with both traditional and innovative winemaking philosophies, using new types of oak for barrels, barrel size and age, and varying length of aging in the bottle before commercial release. To succeed at best expressing what a vineyard, grape, and a winemaker can achieve requires constant trial and error, both in the vineyard and in the winery. At Marchesi Antinori, these experiments include a wide range of different grape varieties and clones, planted in a variety of vineyards, different styles and sizes of fermentors as well as techniques of fermentation; barrel types and sizes; length of barrel and bottle aging.

wines.name: Amaranta Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2022
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Abruzzo (Abruzzes) / Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
wines.description:
Celebrated as ‘a deep and powerful wine that a novice can appreciate as much as a connoisseur’, the Amaranta Montepulciano d'Abruzzo is one of our best-selling reds for good reason.

Tenuta Ulisse’s Amaranta Montepulciano D’Abruzzo is a distinguished wine originating from the Montepulciano grape, giving it its distinctive ruby red with garnet reflections hue. Fermented for nine to 12 months in fine French and American barriques, the experienced winemakers have harnessed the full potential of the extraordinary terroirs and microclimates found within the Abruzzo region, to produce a drop unlike any other. 

The Vivino community rates Tenuta Ulisse Amaranta Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2022 vintage as better than any other year for this wine, so if you’re new to this wine, 2022’s vintage is a good place to start. On the other hand, Tenuta Ulisse Amaranta Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2016 vintage ranks number one in the Top 25 Italian Montepulciano d'Abruzzo wines in the United States right now, making it a guaranteed crowd pleaser.

Whether planning for a large dinner party, an intimate gathering or a date night for two, this wine pairs exquisitely with beef, pork, veal and pasta.

wines.name: Suzzane Rioja 2023
wines.description:
Suzzane is a red wine from the D.O.C La Rioja produced by Oxer Belastegi in Laguardia, Alava.

Oxer Bastegieta is a winemaker who began to produce Chacolí at the family winery in Kortezubi, a small Basque town close to the Urdaibai natural park. He first moved to Rioja to study a masters in oenology and viticulture, where he fell in love with the landscapes of the Rioja Alavesa. He then set up residence in Laguardia in 2009 where he began to inspect the vineyards and began to produce wines from the zone.

Suzzane is another of his wines that comes from 3 small Garnacha vineyards situated in the town of Cárdenas, close to Nájera and home to calcareous-clay soils. The vineyards used are over 105 years old, span across 2.5 hectares and have low yields of around 1000kg per hectare. The vineyards are cultivated and worked organically.

Suzzane ferments in stainless steel tanks using its own yeasts. Following this the wine undergoes malolactic fermentation and is aged in new (500litre) French oak barrels.

wines.name: Corimbo I 2017
wines.description:
Colour:
Cherry red in colour, against a dark background with slight purple edging. Deep, intense colouring..

Nose:
Very intense and voluminous, yet elegant and polished. The fruits of the vineyard and the grape harvest stand out strongly against the hint of ripeness, which is detected at the bottom. Blackberries and damsons are clearly identificable against a background impression of aromatic plants flowering in the pine forest. A deep mineral note rounds off the aromatic profile of this magnificent wine.

Palate:
Voluminous, ample, filling the mouth with black fruits that give way to notes of aromatic plants and earthiness. The wine finishes with a deep freshness, reminiscent of special qualities of the land during an excellent year. The 2010 harvest was magnificent at La Horra, contributing freshness and elegance against a background of impeccable maturity. The fine, fresh tannins add character and class to the Corimbo range, which is a new interpretation of the classic Ribera del Duero.

wines.name: Ribera del Duero Crianza 2023

wines.name: Reserva Especial Ribera del Duero 2020
wines.description: It has high intensity, intense cardinal red with purple hues.The first sensations are fresh and friendly, giving way to the smoothness and fleshiness that characterize the wine. To end with a long aftertaste where we again recall the spicy aromas and caramel.

Medium-high cherry red robe, with orange tinted tones on the edge of the glass, clear and brilliant. Intense and complex to the nose. Wild berry aromas predominate, blended with hints of coconut, cinnamon, tobacco and leather. Full-bodied and well structured to the palate, with silky and enveloping tannins.
Long after-taste acquired from its lengthy time in bottle, where its elegant bouquet gains in intensity. This Viña Ardanza continues to evolve without losing its traditional qualities.

The combination of old Callet vines, that only exist in Mallorca, with a poor and mineral soil (iron ore) under limestone rocks, competing with fruit trees that are planted around the vines, give a unique character to these parcels and to the resulting wines.

wines.name: Ribera del Duero Una Cepa I 2019

The typical flavours of our grape and our region are evident with liquorice, black berries, coffee, tobacco and spice.

wines.name: LeDomaine Blanco de Guarda 2023
wines.description:
Clean, brilliant, yellow, almost waxy in the glass. On the nose, an intense bouquet of
honey, peaches in syrup, ginger, white flowers and mint fused together with notes of
smoke. Smooth in the mouth, opening up with exotic citrus and white fruit (grapefruit
and apple), merged with a hint of freshly cut hay and aniseed, all blending well with the
wood. Perfectly balanced acidity that brings freshness and a lasting finish without
stepping on its rounded oiliness. A wine for laying down, a wine full of surprises.

wines.name: Roda I Reserva Rioja 2019

wines.name: Gran Reserva 2015

Smell: On the nose it is round, elegant and very complex, showing a complex bouquet, offering hints of vanilla, cinamon, cocoa, leather, liquorice, calcareous mineral and different and complex red fruit. The diversity of fruity and wood aromas gives the wine roundness and complexity.

wines.description: A wine with an attractive collection of balsamic notes, of chocolate and black fruits, very warm in the mouth and an extremely pleasant finish.

wines.name: Tinto 2023
wines.description:
Smooth and deep ruby in color, Pago de Carraovejas Tinto is a robust red wine from the wine region of Ribera del Duero, Spain, which is located at the southern tip of the province of Burgos. It’s renowned for its cherry, blackberry and vanilla notes, alongside low acidity and low tannins. Perfect for wine connoisseurs and novices alike, it’s the perfect bottle to share alongside friends over a delicious dinner. 

As for pairings, this wine is an excellent choice to enjoy alongside meaty dishes that involve beef, lamb and game, so it’s perfect for sipping alongside a succulent steak dinner on date night. Made from the Tempranillo grape, this wine is rated highly across all of its vintages, however its 2018 vintage featured in the Top 25 Spanish Ribera del Duero red wines in the United States right now, so that might be a bottle you want to get your hands on. Additionally, its 2016 vintage rates better than any other year, so it’s fair to say this wine is an all round good choice, regardless of the vintage you choose. 

Read on for more reviews and pricing on Pago de Carraovejas Tinto at Vivino.

wines.name: Viña Gravonia 2014
wines.description: Fully golden, rich and deep yellow in colour. Aromas fresh and concise, showing ripe lemon with almost a sweet edge alongside hay meadow and touches of deeper tropical fruits. The palate is mouth filling and incredibly complex with fantastic acidity and freshness. Candied fruits with a lovely tangy dry/fresh balance, waxy apple and turkish delight all sit beautifully with a finish.

wines.name: Côte-Rôtie 2022
wines.region: France / Vallée du Rhône / Nord de la vallée du Rhône / Côte-Rôtie
wines.description: This aromatic and deliciously textured Côte-Rôtie is a blend of Syrah from Viallière in the north and Beton in the south. It comes from a parcel at Fongeant on the Côte Blonde and has 10% Viognier in the blend. All the fruit is harvested by hand with a strict selection so that only the ripest bunches and berries make it into the final blend. It is 100% destemmed and the vinification is traditional with long skin contact and regular punch downs and pumping over. The wine then spends 18 months in barrique. It has an almost Burgundian set of characteristics about it; very aromatic, with violet, blackberry and underlying spice notes, a creamy palate with round tannins and then a crisp, aromatic close. A delightful Côte-Rôtie that is already drinking well.

wines.description:
Renowned red wine, full-bodied, strong and distinguished.
It is dry, noble, with a delicate bouquet, balanced and rich in alcohol. It has a strong avour and velvety texture with a characteristic vein of bitterness. Amarone is a wine ideally suited to accompany roast meat, game and strong cheeses.
The “Amarone” appellation dates back to the 8th/10th Century when it became necessary to label a wine produced with raisins, similar
to Recioto but with completely different characteristics.
The serving temperature is 18°C and it should be uncorked at least an hour before serving and decanted into a carafe.

wines.name: Badia a Passignano Gran Selezione Chianti Classico 2020
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Toscane / Chianti / Chianti Classico
wines.description: Marchesi Antinori’s passion for viticulture is expressed through perseverance: their continuous pursuit for quality improvement, even in the smallest details. Research and development is an ongoing process both in the vineyards and in the cellars: selecting new clones of local and international varieties: experimenting with new techniques in the vineyards and vineyard altitudes, new approaches to fermentation and temperature control, experimenting with both traditional and innovative winemaking philosophies, using new types of oak for barrels, barrel size and age, and varying length of aging in the bottle before commercial release. To succeed at best expressing what a vineyard, grape, and a winemaker can achieve requires constant trial and error, both in the vineyard and in the winery. At Marchesi Antinori, these experiments include a wide range of different grape varieties and clones, planted in a variety of vineyards, different styles and sizes of fermentors as well as techniques of fermentation; barrel types and sizes; length of barrel and bottle aging.

wines.description: It is bright ruby red and bright, with light garnet hues. It reveals excellent consistency. Then progressively come grassy notes of good mountain hay, herbs, myrtle berries, bay leaves, but also pleasant floral perceptions of dried violet balsamic eucalyptus. wines.name: Venezia Giulia Picol 2022
wines.region: Italie / Northern Italy / Frioul-Vénétie Julienne / Friuli Isonzo
wines.description:
Sauvignon Blanc is an international grape planted in many areas of the world. The two leading schools (areas) are French. The Loire valley produces a style of wine which is highly aromatic, salty and mineral, while in Bordeaux, where this grape is often combined with Semillion, is characterized by a good structure and body. In both cases only the best examples will be elegant and refined.
The right bank of Isonzo river has gravelly and warm soils, which are crucial to gain greater structure. As for climate, it is characterized by wide changes of temperature due to winds coming from the Balkans and by Mediterranean influxes from the nearby sea. These aspects put together create in this area the right conditions for a “Friulian style of Sauvignon Blanc”.

wines.name: Brunello di Montalcino 2020
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Toscane / Brunello di Montalcino
wines.description: This wine has shows a ruby colour with violet hues. It is an highly structured wine, full and persistent. The ripe soft tannins are perfectly balanced with the acidity, long pleasant and sapid aftertaste.

wines.name: Famiglia Pasqua Amarone della Valpolicella 2019
wines.region: Italie / Northern Italy / Vénétie / Valpolicella / Amarone della Valpolicella
wines.description:
An elegant, full-bodied deep ruby red wine, with clean and vibrant
fragrances of currants, blackberries and sweet almonds on
the nose, with notes of vanilla. Warm and rich, with polished, silky
tannins and a long finish.

wines.name: Cabernet Sant'Antimo Olmaia 2018
wines.description:
It has very deep with shining purple reflexes. Excellent structure, full and enveloping.
The tannins, ripe and persistent, are perfectly combined with the fruit and the notes of the oak. The aftertaste is soft, pleasant and long.

wines.name: Pinot Bianco Riserva Vorberg 2023
wines.region: Italie / Northern Italy / Trentin-Haut-Adige / Südtirol - Alto Adige
wines.description: The interplay of fruity aromatic and salty components is repeated on the palate, where the soft and creamy elements gain greater strength in a wine with a lingering, firmly minerally and spicy character on the aftertaste.
food_pairings: Fromage doux et à pâte molle

wines.name: Dominio de Atauta 2020
wines.description: Bright cherry colour. Intensely perfumed with complex aromas of ripe raspberries and blackberries interlaced with lavender, rosemary and chamomile on a delicate backdrop of spices and smoky oak. On the palate it shows balance and energy with red and dark berry flavours followed by floral and delicately spiced nuances. Mature tannins and lingering finish.

wines.name: Vign’angena Vermentino di Gallura 2024
wines.region: Italie / Southern Italy / Sardegna / Vermentino di Gallura
wines.description: It has pale straw yellow with soft light green tinges, extremely limpid. It contains evoking intense floral scents of orange blossom, iris, Scotch broom, hawthorn and fruity yellow apple fragrance with pleasant mineral notes. It has fresh, lively with a full and fragrant essence; it closes with a lovely fruity and persistent finish.

wines.name: Brunello di Montalcino 2020
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Toscane / Brunello di Montalcino
wines.description: Deep ruby red with garnet nuances. Notes of red fruits with sharp aromas of liquorice, spices and black pepper. Sweetness in the attack is balanced by the fresh and lingering finish. In the mid palate, the wine is full bodied. The tannins are dense, well rounded and integrated.

wines.name: Collis Breclemae Ghemme 2017
wines.description: Ruby-garnet red color. enveloping scent, with notes of liquorice, red berries, hints of violets. The taste is a distinctive, fine and persistent flavor and elegant feeling of fullness embellished with soft tannins that harmonize its vibrant structure.

wines.name: Mazzamurello Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2021
wines.region: Italie / Central Italy / Abruzzo (Abruzzes) / Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

wines.name: Toscana 2020
wines.description: Il Borro has a purple color with intense reflections purpurei. The smell is intense, full, concentrated, with notes of underbrush and hints of spices. The taste is dry, full-bodied and with soft tannins, consistent and well-blended, remarkably persistent.

wines.name: Tecnica del Salasso Tre di Tre 2023
Les Camades Garnatxa Blanca 2020
food_pairings: Fromage affiné et à pâte dure
Fromage doux et à pâte molle

wines.name: Lara O 2022
wines.description: Cherry red with violet edge Nose: Berries, very clean toasted wood, balsamic, mineral, very elegant. Soft and delicate, good balance and acidity with notes of fruit and minerality.

wines.name: Rioja Blanco Reserva 2016
wines.grapes: Maturana Blanca, Malvasia, Viura, Garnacha Blanca

wines.name: Vigna La Rosa Barolo 2017
wines.description: Apricot, violets, coffee, tar and kirsch aromas. The palate is powerful, but also balanced and structured. Long and utterly delicious. While its alcoholic strength gives it a very long shelf life, it is not too high to make it a highly enjoyable, smooth, round product with a lovely bitter-sweet balance in the mouth. Its very intense, complex nose features the aroma of calisaya bark, while also showing clear hints of cinnamon, cloves (very noticeable on the taste too), nutmeg and aromatic herbs.

wines.name: Beaune Premier Cru Les Marconnets (Cuvée Signature) 2020
wines.region: France / Bourgogne / Côte de Beaune / Beaune / Beaune Premier Cru
wines.description:
Intense ruby red colour.
Nose: Notes of blackberry and raspberry.
Palate: It is full and tannic on the palate with flavours echoing the fruity aromas perceived on the nose. The finish brings out roasted flavours of coffee and mocha. Tough a little closed when uncorked, this wine fully expresses itself after a few minutes in the glass.

wines.name: Les Margues 2022
food_pairings: Fromage affiné et à pâte dure
Fromage doux et à pâte molle

wines.name: Masia Carreras Empordà Blanco 2023
wines.description: Intense straw yellow with golden reflections. Tear a little glycerine. very expressive with a strong fruit load on tropical fruit with a pineapple very present, and citrus are mixed up with toast and creamy notes noise. very fresh and tasty. Check this very gentle with the fruit well balanced with lively acidity. Light smoky and spicy palate.

wines.name: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru (Grand Cru Classé) 2016
wines.region: France / Bordeaux / Libournais / Saint-Émilion / Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
wines.description: The color is deep red. The nose is deep, marked by black fruits mixed with floral notes. Some very subtle woody notes complete the nose. The first taste is nice, sweet and deep at the same time, it goes on a juicy structure with body, it is refined with a velvety palate. The finish is very fresh, dense, persistent on a brilliant fruit associated with mineral notes.
